intro: Agalinis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis parvifolia is often found in association with other grassland species and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
